attributes.content: [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Google\", \"resolved_domain\": \"google.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy \\u2013 Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"Google collects information to provide and improve its services, including data you provide (name, password, phone, payment info, content you create), information from your apps, browsers, and devices (unique identifiers, settings, IP address, crash reports), your activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice info, purchase activity, communication, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices). Data is used for service provision, maintenance, improvement, new service development, personalization (content and ads), performance measurement, communication, and protection against fraud and security issues. Google does not sell personal information. Information is shared with consent, with domain administrators, for external processing, and for legal reasons. Data is retained for varying periods, with options for users to delete or auto-delete certain data. Google employs security measures like encryption and access restrictions. Users have controls to manage, review, update, export, and delete their information through their Google Account, Activity Controls, Ad settings, and browser/device settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.98, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official and comprehensive Google Privacy Policy, directly addressing all aspects of data collection, usage, sharing, retention, and user rights.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"Your privacy is protected by responsible data practices.\", \"summary\": \"Google emphasizes its commitment to privacy by design, stating it never sells personal information and is transparent about data collection and usage. It provides users with easy controls to manage their data, including reviewing, downloading, and deleting it. Google protects data with advanced security infrastructures and continuously innovates privacy technologies, sharing them with others. Data minimization practices include auto-deletion of Location History and Web & App Activity after 18 months by default for new accounts. Users can view and delete data through Dashboard and My Activity, and export their data. Google complies with applicable data protection laws and works with regulatory authorities.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page directly addresses Google's data protection principles, practices, and user controls, providing a high-level overview of their approach to privacy and data handling.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and AI - Transparency Center\", \"summary\": \"This page from Google's Transparency Center outlines their commitment to user privacy and security, guided by Privacy and Security Principles. It explains what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review, update, or remove their data. It also mentions the Google API Services User Data Policy, which focuses on privacy and security requirements for developers using Google APIs. Additionally, it touches upon Google's approach to responsible AI development and related privacy hubs and policies for Gemini Apps and Generative AI, including restrictions on content creation and distribution.\", \"relevance\": 0.9, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page provides a good overview of Google's privacy policy, terms of service, and specific policies related to AI, acting as a central hub for understanding their data practices.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"This is the main hub for Google's Privacy & Terms, providing an overview of what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review and update it. It links to the full Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. The page also highlights the Google Safety Center, Google Account for managing privacy, and Google's Privacy and Security Principles. It emphasizes user control over personal information and usage history across various Google products like Gmail, Search, and YouTube.\", \"relevance\": 0.85, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the overarching page for Google's privacy and terms, serving as an entry point to more detailed policies. It provides a good summary of their privacy principles and links to relevant resources.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"task_prompt\": \"privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices\", \"results\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This Google Privacy Policy outlines what information Google collects, why it collects it, and how users can update, manage, export, and delete their information. It applies to all services offered by Google LLC and its affiliates, including YouTube and Android, and services on third-party sites. The policy also addresses compliance with European Union and United Kingdom data protection laws, detailing user rights and Google's obligations.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google collects information to provide, maintain, and improve its services, develop new offerings, and personalize user experiences, including content and ads.\", \"Data is also used to measure performance, communicate with users, and protect Google, its users, and the public from fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues.\", \"Information collected includes data provided by users (name, password, phone, payment, content), data from apps/browsers/devices (unique identifiers, IP address, crash reports), user activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice, purchases, communications, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices).\", \"Information is also collected from publicly accessible sources and trusted partners (directory services, marketing, security partners).\", \"Data collection technologies include cookies, pixel tags, local storage, databases, and server logs.\", \"User privacy controls are available through Google Account settings (Activity Controls, Ad settings, About you, Shared endorsements), Privacy Checkup, My Activity, Google Dashboard, and device/browser settings.\", \"Information sharing occurs with user consent, with domain administrators, for external processing by trusted parties, and for legal reasons (law, regulation, legal process, governmental requests, Terms of Service enforcement, fraud/security protection, public safety). Non-personally identifiable information may be shared publicly with partners.\", \"Security measures include encryption for data in transit, security features (Safe Browsing, 2 Step Verification), review of data practices, physical security, and restricted access to personal information for authorized personnel.\", \"Users can export a copy of their data or delete content from specific services, items from My Activity, specific products, or their entire Google Account. An Inactive Account Manager allows designated access.\", \"Data retention varies: some data is kept until deleted by the user or auto-deleted, some is deleted/anonymized automatically after a set period, some is kept until account deletion, and some is retained longer for legitimate business or legal purposes (security, fraud prevention, financial records). A deletion process ensures safe removal, with potential delays.\", \"Google will not reduce user rights under this Privacy Policy without explicit consent.\", \"Personalized ads are not shown based on sensitive categories (race, religion, sexual orientation, health) or content from Drive, Gmail, or Photos.\", \"Personally identifiable information is not shared with advertisers unless explicitly requested by the user.\", \"Explicit consent is required before using information for purposes not covered in the Privacy Policy.\", \"Google complies with applicable data protection laws, including EU and UK regulations, and provides mechanisms for users to exercise their rights.\", \"Data processing is based on legal grounds such as contract performance, legitimate interests, vital interests, legal obligations, or user consent.\", \"Google (Google Ireland Limited for EEA/Switzerland, Google LLC for UK and global Search/Maps) acts as the data controller, responsible for processing information and complying with privacy laws.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their privacy settings and exercising their rights to control, review, update, export, and delete their information.\", \"Domain administrators (for organizational accounts) have access to and control over user accounts, including the ability to access/retain information, view statistics, change passwords, suspend/terminate access, and restrict data management options.\", \"Affiliates and trusted third-party businesses process personal information on Google's behalf, adhering to Google's instructions, Privacy Policy, and confidentiality/security measures.\", \"Partners (publishers, advertisers, developers, rights holders) may collect information from user browsers/devices for advertising and measurement purposes, or receive non-personally identifiable information from Google.\", \"Google continuously works to detect, prevent, and respond to fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues that could harm Google, its users, or the public.\", \"The policy is regularly reviewed for compliance, and Google processes information in ways that adhere to it.\", \"Data transfers occur globally, with the same protections applied regardless of server location, and Google complies with legal frameworks for data transfer.\", \"For EU/UK users, Google provides controls to exercise rights (access, update, remove, restrict processing, object, export) and offers contact points for questions or concerns, including local data protection authorities.\", \"Google responds to formal written complaints and cooperates with regulatory authorities to resolve data transfer issues.\", \"Personal information is shared for legal reasons, including responding to applicable laws, regulations, legal processes, or enforceable governmental requests, with details published in a Transparency Report.\", \"Google analyzes content to detect abuse (spam, malware, illegal content) and may disable accounts or report violations to authorities. Age verification processes are in place to ensure users meet service requirements.\", \"The Privacy Policy is effective July 1, 2025, with archived versions available.\", \"Key terms such as 'Affiliates', 'Algorithm', 'Cookies', 'Personal information', and 'Sensitive personal information' are defined within the policy.\", \"Specific privacy notices are provided for various Google services like Payments, Fiber, Gemini Apps, YouTube Kids, and Google Workspace for Education.\", \"Additional resources are available, including Your Google Account, Privacy Checkup, Google\\u2019s safety center, Google\\u2019s Teen Privacy Guide, and information on technologies used.\", \"Changes to the policy will not reduce user rights without explicit consent, and significant changes will be communicated with prominent notice.\", \"EU users have choices regarding linking certain Google services.\"], \"relevance\": 0.98}], \"error_message\": null}, \"query\": \"Summarize Google's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

attributes.gen_ai.operation.name: invoke_agent
attributes.gen_ai.agent.name: Strands Agents
attributes.system_prompt:
You are the SUMMARY AGENT.

You take:
- search_result: the raw results from search_agent (contains URLs & policy types)
- extraction_result: the structured extracted points from extract_agent
- user_query: what the user is asking for (e.g., "data collection practices")

Your job is to generate a FINAL TRANSPARENT SUMMARY with the following goals:

1. Summarize the company's data practices clearly and concisely.
2. Provide a multi-dimensional rating system:
   - data_collection_risk: 1–5
   - data_sharing_risk: 1–5
   - tracking_risk: 1–5
   - transparency_score: 1–5
3. Explain WHY you assigned each rating.
   - Refer EXPLICITLY to specific extracted_points and their source URLs.
4. Provide user safety guidance:
   - How users can protect themselves on this platform.
   - What settings they can change.
   - What rights they have (e.g. delete data, opt-out of tracking).
5. Provide a final consumer-friendly summary:
   - “Should users be concerned?”
   - “How careful should users be?”
6. List all sources used, with URLs and relevance.

STRICT OUTPUT FORMAT:
{
  "status": "success" | "error",
  "query": "<original query>",
  "summary": {
    "overview": "<plain-language high-level summary>",
    "key_findings": ["...", "..."],
    "ratings": {
      "data_collection_risk": <1-5>,
      "data_sharing_risk": <1-5>,
      "tracking_risk": <1-5>,
      "transparency_score": <1-5>
    },
    "reasoning": [
      {
        "rating": "<which rating>",
        "evidence": [
          {
            "url": "<source url>",
            "point": "<specific extracted_point from extraction_result>"
          }
        ],
        "explanation": "<why this evidence led to the rating>"
      }
    ],
    "user_protection_advice": ["...", "..."],
    "final_recommendation": "<string>"
  },
  "sources_used": [
    {
      "url": "<string>",
      "policy_type": "<string>",
      "relevance": <float>,
      "title": "<string or null>"
    }
  ],
  "error_message": "<null or string>"
}

RULES:
- No markdown.
- No code fences.
- Citations MUST reference actual URLs from search_result.
- Evidence MUST reference extracted_points from extraction_result.
- If extraction_result.status != success → return status:error.

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs: {"status": "success", "query": "Summarize Google's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).", "summary": {"overview": "Google's privacy policy outlines extensive data collection practices across its services to provide, maintain, and improve offerings, personalize experiences, and ensure security. While Google states it does not sell personal information, it shares data with trusted partners for processing, with domain administrators for organizational accounts, and for legal reasons. Users are provided with comprehensive controls to manage, review, export, and delete their data, and Google emphasizes compliance with data protection laws like those in the EU and UK.", "key_findings": ["Google collects a wide array of information, including user-provided data, device information, activity data (searches, videos, ad interactions, third-party site activity), and precise location data.", "Data is used for service provision, personalization (including ads), performance measurement, communication, and protection against fraud and security risks.", "Google employs various data collection technologies such as cookies, pixel tags, local storage, databases, and server logs.", "Personal information is not sold, but it is shared with user consent, with domain administrators, with trusted third-party processors, and when legally required.", "Users have extensive privacy controls through their Google Account, Activity Controls, Ad settings, Privacy Checkup, and My Activity, allowing them to manage, export, and delete their data.", "Data retention periods vary, with options for auto-deletion for some data types, and some data retained for legitimate business or legal purposes.", "Google complies with applicable data protection laws and provides mechanisms for users to exercise their rights, including access, update, removal, and objection to processing."], "ratings": {"data_collection_risk": 4, "data_sharing_risk": 3, "tracking_risk": 4, "transparency_score": 4}, "reasoning": [{"rating": "data_collection_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Information collected includes data provided by users (name, password, phone, payment, content), data from apps/browsers/devices (unique identifiers, IP address, crash reports), user activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice, purchases, communications, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices)."}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Information is also collected from publicly accessible sources and trusted partners (directory services, marketing, security partners)."}], "explanation": "Google collects a very broad and deep range of personal information, including highly sensitive data like precise location, activity across its services and third-party sites, and content created by users. This extensive collection, even if for service improvement and personalization, presents a higher inherent risk."}, {"rating": "data_sharing_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Information sharing occurs with user consent, with domain administrators, for external processing by trusted parties, and for legal reasons (law, regulation, legal process, governmental requests, Terms of Service enforcement, fraud/security protection, public safety). Non-personally identifiable information may be shared publicly with partners."}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Affiliates and trusted third-party businesses process personal information on Google's behalf, adhering to Google's instructions, Privacy Policy, and confidentiality/security measures."}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Domain administrators (for organizational accounts) have access to and control over user accounts, including the ability to access/retain information, view statistics, change passwords, suspend/terminate access, and restrict data management options."}], "explanation": "While Google explicitly states it does not sell personal information, it shares data with a variety of entities including trusted third-party processors, affiliates, and crucially, with domain administrators for organizational accounts who have significant control. Sharing for legal reasons also introduces a potential risk, leading to a moderate data sharing risk score."}, {"rating": "tracking_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Data collection technologies include cookies, pixel tags, local storage, databases, and server logs."}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Information collected includes... user activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice, purchases, communications, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices)."}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Google collects information to provide, maintain, and improve its services, develop new offerings, and personalize user experiences, including content and ads."}], "explanation": "Google utilizes a wide array of tracking technologies and collects extensive user activity data across its own services and third-party sites. This data is explicitly used for personalization, including targeted advertising, indicating a high level of user tracking."}, {"rating": "transparency_score", "evidence": [{"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Google collects information to provide, maintain, and improve its services, develop new offerings, and personalize user experiences, including content and ads."}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "User privacy controls are available through Google Account settings (Activity Controls, Ad settings, About you, Shared endorsements), Privacy Checkup, My Activity, Google Dashboard, and device/browser settings."}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Users can export a copy of their data or delete content from specific services, items from My Activity, specific products, or their entire Google Account."}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Changes to the policy will not reduce user rights without explicit consent, and significant changes will be communicated with prominent notice."}], "explanation": "Google provides a highly detailed and accessible privacy policy that clearly explains what data is collected, why, and how it's used. It offers robust and granular user controls, mechanisms for data export and deletion, and commits to transparent communication regarding policy changes and user rights. This comprehensive approach earns a high transparency score."}], "user_protection_advice": ["Regularly review and adjust your Google Account's Activity Controls (Web & App Activity, Location History, YouTube History) to limit the data Google collects and retains. Consider enabling auto-delete options for certain data types.", "Utilize the Privacy Checkup tool in your Google Account to review and manage key privacy settings.", "Manage your Ad settings to understand how ads are personalized and to turn off ad personalization if desired.", "Periodically review your 'My Activity' page to see what data Google has collected about your interactions and delete specific items or entire activity categories.", "Be aware that for organizational accounts (e.g., work or school), your domain administrator has significant control over your account and data.", "Exercise your data rights, such as exporting a copy of your data or deleting your entire Google Account if you wish to remove your information from Google's services.", "Adjust browser and device settings to manage cookies and location permissions, which can further limit data collection."], "final_recommendation": "Users should be aware that Google's services are built upon extensive data collection and tracking, which is clearly outlined in its policies. While Google offers robust transparency and user controls, the sheer volume of data collected means users should be highly proactive in managing their privacy settings and regularly reviewing their activity. If you value privacy above personalized convenience, you should carefully configure your Google Account settings and consider limiting your use of certain Google services."}, "sources_used": [{"url": "https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "privacy_policy", "relevance": 0.98, "title": "Privacy Policy – Privacy & Terms – Google"}, {"url": "https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.95, "title": "Your privacy is protected by responsible data practices."}, {"url": "https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "other", "relevance": 0.9, "title": "Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and AI - Transparency Center"}, {"url": "https://policies.google.com/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "other", "relevance": 0.85, "title": "Privacy & Terms – Google"}], "error_message": null}

attributes.content: [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Google\", \"resolved_domain\": \"google.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy \\u2013 Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"Google collects information to provide and improve its services, including data you provide (name, password, phone, payment info, content you create), information from your apps, browsers, and devices (unique identifiers, settings, IP address, crash reports), your activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice info, purchase activity, communication, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices). Data is used for service provision, maintenance, improvement, new service development, personalization (content and ads), performance measurement, communication, and protection against fraud and security issues. Google does not sell personal information. Information is shared with consent, with domain administrators, for external processing, and for legal reasons. Data is retained for varying periods, with options for users to delete or auto-delete certain data. Google employs security measures like encryption and access restrictions. Users have controls to manage, review, update, export, and delete their information through their Google Account, Activity Controls, Ad settings, and browser/device settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.98, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official and comprehensive Google Privacy Policy, directly addressing all aspects of data collection, usage, sharing, retention, and user rights.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"Your privacy is protected by responsible data practices.\", \"summary\": \"Google emphasizes its commitment to privacy by design, stating it never sells personal information and is transparent about data collection and usage. It provides users with easy controls to manage their data, including reviewing, downloading, and deleting it. Google protects data with advanced security infrastructures and continuously innovates privacy technologies, sharing them with others. Data minimization practices include auto-deletion of Location History and Web & App Activity after 18 months by default for new accounts. Users can view and delete data through Dashboard and My Activity, and export their data. Google complies with applicable data protection laws and works with regulatory authorities.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page directly addresses Google's data protection principles, practices, and user controls, providing a high-level overview of their approach to privacy and data handling.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and AI - Transparency Center\", \"summary\": \"This page from Google's Transparency Center outlines their commitment to user privacy and security, guided by Privacy and Security Principles. It explains what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review, update, or remove their data. It also mentions the Google API Services User Data Policy, which focuses on privacy and security requirements for developers using Google APIs. Additionally, it touches upon Google's approach to responsible AI development and related privacy hubs and policies for Gemini Apps and Generative AI, including restrictions on content creation and distribution.\", \"relevance\": 0.9, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page provides a good overview of Google's privacy policy, terms of service, and specific policies related to AI, acting as a central hub for understanding their data practices.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"This is the main hub for Google's Privacy & Terms, providing an overview of what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review and update it. It links to the full Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. The page also highlights the Google Safety Center, Google Account for managing privacy, and Google's Privacy and Security Principles. It emphasizes user control over personal information and usage history across various Google products like Gmail, Search, and YouTube.\", \"relevance\": 0.85, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the overarching page for Google's privacy and terms, serving as an entry point to more detailed policies. It provides a good summary of their privacy principles and links to relevant resources.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"task_prompt\": \"privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices\", \"results\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This Google Privacy Policy outlines what information Google collects, why it collects it, and how users can update, manage, export, and delete their information. It applies to all services offered by Google LLC and its affiliates, including YouTube and Android, and services on third-party sites. The policy also addresses compliance with European Union and United Kingdom data protection laws, detailing user rights and Google's obligations.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google collects information to provide, maintain, and improve its services, develop new offerings, and personalize user experiences, including content and ads.\", \"Data is also used to measure performance, communicate with users, and protect Google, its users, and the public from fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues.\", \"Information collected includes data provided by users (name, password, phone, payment, content), data from apps/browsers/devices (unique identifiers, IP address, crash reports), user activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice, purchases, communications, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices).\", \"Information is also collected from publicly accessible sources and trusted partners (directory services, marketing, security partners).\", \"Data collection technologies include cookies, pixel tags, local storage, databases, and server logs.\", \"User privacy controls are available through Google Account settings (Activity Controls, Ad settings, About you, Shared endorsements), Privacy Checkup, My Activity, Google Dashboard, and device/browser settings.\", \"Information sharing occurs with user consent, with domain administrators, for external processing by trusted parties, and for legal reasons (law, regulation, legal process, governmental requests, Terms of Service enforcement, fraud/security protection, public safety). Non-personally identifiable information may be shared publicly with partners.\", \"Security measures include encryption for data in transit, security features (Safe Browsing, 2 Step Verification), review of data practices, physical security, and restricted access to personal information for authorized personnel.\", \"Users can export a copy of their data or delete content from specific services, items from My Activity, specific products, or their entire Google Account. An Inactive Account Manager allows designated access.\", \"Data retention varies: some data is kept until deleted by the user or auto-deleted, some is deleted/anonymized automatically after a set period, some is kept until account deletion, and some is retained longer for legitimate business or legal purposes (security, fraud prevention, financial records). A deletion process ensures safe removal, with potential delays.\", \"Google will not reduce user rights under this Privacy Policy without explicit consent.\", \"Personalized ads are not shown based on sensitive categories (race, religion, sexual orientation, health) or content from Drive, Gmail, or Photos.\", \"Personally identifiable information is not shared with advertisers unless explicitly requested by the user.\", \"Explicit consent is required before using information for purposes not covered in the Privacy Policy.\", \"Google complies with applicable data protection laws, including EU and UK regulations, and provides mechanisms for users to exercise their rights.\", \"Data processing is based on legal grounds such as contract performance, legitimate interests, vital interests, legal obligations, or user consent.\", \"Google (Google Ireland Limited for EEA/Switzerland, Google LLC for UK and global Search/Maps) acts as the data controller, responsible for processing information and complying with privacy laws.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their privacy settings and exercising their rights to control, review, update, export, and delete their information.\", \"Domain administrators (for organizational accounts) have access to and control over user accounts, including the ability to access/retain information, view statistics, change passwords, suspend/terminate access, and restrict data management options.\", \"Affiliates and trusted third-party businesses process personal information on Google's behalf, adhering to Google's instructions, Privacy Policy, and confidentiality/security measures.\", \"Partners (publishers, advertisers, developers, rights holders) may collect information from user browsers/devices for advertising and measurement purposes, or receive non-personally identifiable information from Google.\", \"Google continuously works to detect, prevent, and respond to fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues that could harm Google, its users, or the public.\", \"The policy is regularly reviewed for compliance, and Google processes information in ways that adhere to it.\", \"Data transfers occur globally, with the same protections applied regardless of server location, and Google complies with legal frameworks for data transfer.\", \"For EU/UK users, Google provides controls to exercise rights (access, update, remove, restrict processing, object, export) and offers contact points for questions or concerns, including local data protection authorities.\", \"Google responds to formal written complaints and cooperates with regulatory authorities to resolve data transfer issues.\", \"Personal information is shared for legal reasons, including responding to applicable laws, regulations, legal processes, or enforceable governmental requests, with details published in a Transparency Report.\", \"Google analyzes content to detect abuse (spam, malware, illegal content) and may disable accounts or report violations to authorities. Age verification processes are in place to ensure users meet service requirements.\", \"The Privacy Policy is effective July 1, 2025, with archived versions available.\", \"Key terms such as 'Affiliates', 'Algorithm', 'Cookies', 'Personal information', and 'Sensitive personal information' are defined within the policy.\", \"Specific privacy notices are provided for various Google services like Payments, Fiber, Gemini Apps, YouTube Kids, and Google Workspace for Education.\", \"Additional resources are available, including Your Google Account, Privacy Checkup, Google\\u2019s safety center, Google\\u2019s Teen Privacy Guide, and information on technologies used.\", \"Changes to the policy will not reduce user rights without explicit consent, and significant changes will be communicated with prominent notice.\", \"EU users have choices regarding linking certain Google services.\"], \"relevance\": 0.98}], \"error_message\": null}, \"query\": \"Summarize Google's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

regulations, legal processes, or enforceable governmental requests, with details published in a Transparency Report.\", \"Google analyzes content to detect abuse (spam, malware, illegal content) and may disable accounts or report violations to authorities. Age verification processes are in place to ensure users meet service requirements.\", \"The Privacy Policy is effective July 1, 2025, with archived versions available.\", \"Key terms such as 'Affiliates', 'Algorithm', 'Cookies', 'Personal information', and 'Sensitive personal information' are defined within the policy.\", \"Specific privacy notices are provided for various Google services like Payments, Fiber, Gemini Apps, YouTube Kids, and Google Workspace for Education.\", \"Additional resources are available, including Your Google Account, Privacy Checkup, Google\\u2019s safety center, Google\\u2019s Teen Privacy Guide, and information on technologies used.\", \"Changes to the policy will not reduce user rights without explicit consent, and significant changes will be communicated with prominent notice.\", \"EU users have choices regarding linking certain Google services.\"], \"relevance\": 0.98}], \"error_message\": null}, \"query\": \"Summarize Google's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs: [{"role": "user", "content": [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Google\", \"resolved_domain\": \"google.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy \\u2013 Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"Google collects information to provide and improve its services, including data you provide (name, password, phone, payment info, content you create), information from your apps, browsers, and devices (unique identifiers, settings, IP address, crash reports), your activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice info, purchase activity, communication, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices). Data is used for service provision, maintenance, improvement, new service development, personalization (content and ads), performance measurement, communication, and protection against fraud and security issues. Google does not sell personal information. Information is shared with consent, with domain administrators, for external processing, and for legal reasons. Data is retained for varying periods, with options for users to delete or auto-delete certain data. Google employs security measures like encryption and access restrictions. Users have controls to manage, review, update, export, and delete their information through their Google Account, Activity Controls, Ad settings, and browser/device settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.98, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official and comprehensive Google Privacy Policy, directly addressing all aspects of data collection, usage, sharing, retention, and user rights.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"Your privacy is protected by responsible data practices.\", \"summary\": \"Google emphasizes its commitment to privacy by design, stating it never sells personal information and is transparent about data collection and usage. It provides users with easy controls to manage their data, including reviewing, downloading, and deleting it. Google protects data with advanced security infrastructures and continuously innovates privacy technologies, sharing them with others. Data minimization practices include auto-deletion of Location History and Web & App Activity after 18 months by default for new accounts. Users can view and delete data through Dashboard and My Activity, and export their data. Google complies with applicable data protection laws and works with regulatory authorities.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page directly addresses Google's data protection principles, practices, and user controls, providing a high-level overview of their approach to privacy and data handling.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and AI - Transparency Center\", \"summary\": \"This page from Google's Transparency Center outlines their commitment to user privacy and security, guided by Privacy and Security Principles. It explains what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review, update, or remove their data. It also mentions the Google API Services User Data Policy, which focuses on privacy and security requirements for developers using Google APIs. Additionally, it touches upon Google's approach to responsible AI development and related privacy hubs and policies for Gemini Apps and Generative AI, including restrictions on content creation and distribution.\", \"relevance\": 0.9, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page provides a good overview of Google's privacy policy, terms of service, and specific policies related to AI, acting as a central hub for understanding their data practices.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"This is the main hub for Google's Privacy & Terms, providing an overview of what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review and update it. It links to the full Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. The page also highlights the Google Safety Center, Google Account for managing privacy, and Google's Privacy and Security Principles. It emphasizes user control over personal information and usage history across various Google products like Gmail, Search, and YouTube.\", \"relevance\": 0.85, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the overarching page for Google's privacy and terms, serving as an entry point to more detailed policies. It provides a good summary of their privacy principles and links to relevant resources.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"task_prompt\": \"privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices\", \"results\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This Google Privacy Policy outlines what information Google collects, why it collects it, and how users can update, manage, export, and delete their information. It applies to all services offered by Google LLC and its affiliates, including YouTube and Android, and services on third-party sites. The policy also addresses compliance with European Union and United Kingdom data protection laws, detailing user rights and Google's obligations.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google collects information to provide, maintain, and improve its services, develop new offerings, and personalize user experiences, including content and ads.\", \"Data is also used to measure performance, communicate with users, and protect Google, its users, and the public from fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues.\", \"Information collected includes data provided by users (name, password, phone, payment, content), data from apps/browsers/devices (unique identifiers, IP address, crash reports), user activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice, purchases, communications, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices).\", \"Information is also collected from publicly accessible sources and trusted partners (directory services, marketing, security partners).\", \"Data collection technologies include cookies, pixel tags, local storage, databases, and server logs.\", \"User privacy controls are available through Google Account settings (Activity Controls, Ad settings, About you, Shared endorsements), Privacy Checkup, My Activity, Google Dashboard, and device/browser settings.\", \"Information sharing occurs with user consent, with domain administrators, for external processing by trusted parties, and for legal reasons (law, regulation, legal process, governmental requests, Terms of Service enforcement, fraud/security protection, public safety). Non-personally identifiable information may be shared publicly with partners.\", \"Security measures include encryption for data in transit, security features (Safe Browsing, 2 Step Verification), review of data practices, physical security, and restricted access to personal information for authorized personnel.\", \"Users can export a copy of their data or delete content from specific services, items from My Activity, specific products, or their entire Google Account. An Inactive Account Manager allows designated access.\", \"Data retention varies: some data is kept until deleted by the user or auto-deleted, some is deleted/anonymized automatically after a set period, some is kept until account deletion, and some is retained longer for legitimate business or legal purposes (security, fraud prevention, financial records). A deletion process ensures safe removal, with potential delays.\", \"Google will not reduce user rights under this Privacy Policy without explicit consent.\", \"Personalized ads are not shown based on sensitive categories (race, religion, sexual orientation, health) or content from Drive, Gmail, or Photos.\", \"Personally identifiable information is not shared with advertisers unless explicitly requested by the user.\", \"Explicit consent is required before using information for purposes not covered in the Privacy Policy.\", \"Google complies with applicable data protection laws, including EU and UK regulations, and provides mechanisms for users to exercise their rights.\", \"Data processing is based on legal grounds such as contract performance, legitimate interests, vital interests, legal obligations, or user consent.\", \"Google (Google Ireland Limited for EEA/Switzerland, Google LLC for UK and global Search/Maps) acts as the data controller, responsible for processing information and complying with privacy laws.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their privacy settings and exercising their rights to control, review, update, export, and delete their information.\", \"Domain administrators (for organizational accounts) have access to and control over user accounts, including the ability to access/retain information, view statistics, change passwords, suspend/terminate access, and restrict data management options.\", \"Affiliates and trusted third-party businesses process personal information on Google's behalf, adhering to Google's instructions, Privacy Policy, and confidentiality/security measures.\", \"Partners (publishers, advertisers, developers, rights holders) may collect information from user browsers/devices for advertising and measurement purposes, or receive non-personally identifiable information from Google.\", \"Google continuously works to detect, prevent, and respond to fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues that could harm Google, its users, or the public.\", \"The policy is regularly reviewed for compliance, and Google processes information in ways that adhere to it.\", \"Data transfers occur globally, with the same protections applied regardless of server location, and Google complies with legal frameworks for data transfer.\", \"For EU/UK users, Google provides controls to exercise rights (access, update, remove, restrict processing, object, export) and offers contact points for questions or concerns, including local data protection authorities.\", \"Google responds to formal written complaints and cooperates with regulatory authorities to resolve data transfer issues.\", \"Personal information is shared for legal reasons, including responding to applicable laws, regulations, legal processes, or enforceable governmental requests, with details published in a Transparency Report.\", \"Google analyzes content to detect abuse (spam, malware, illegal content) and may disable accounts or report violations to authorities. Age verification processes are in place to ensure users meet service requirements.\", \"The Privacy Policy is effective July 1, 2025, with archived versions available.\", \"Key terms such as 'Affiliates', 'Algorithm', 'Cookies', 'Personal information', and 'Sensitive personal information' are defined within the policy.\", \"Specific privacy notices are provided for various Google services like Payments, Fiber, Gemini Apps, YouTube Kids, and Google Workspace for Education.\", \"Additional resources are available, including Your Google Account, Privacy Checkup, Google\\u2019s safety center, Google\\u2019s Teen Privacy Guide, and information on technologies used.\", \"Changes to the policy will not reduce user rights without explicit consent, and significant changes will be communicated with prominent notice.\", \"EU users have choices regarding linking certain Google services.\"], \"relevance\": 0.98}], \"error_message\": null}, \"query\": \"Summarize Google's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]}]
